metadata.title: CVE-2023-3106 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A NULL pointer dereference vulnerability was found in netlink_dump. Thisissue can occur when the Netlink socket receives the message(sendmsg) forthe XFRM_MSG_GETSA, XFRM_MSG_GETPOLICY type message, and the DUMP flag isset and can cause a denial of service or possibly another unspecifiedimpact. Due to the nature of the flaw, privilege escalation cannot be fullyruled out, although it is unlikely.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3106` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-184-generic - 4.4.0-184.214
linux-image-4.4.0-184-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-184.214
linux-image-4.4.0-184-lowlatency - 4.4.0-184.214
linux-image-4.4.0-184-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-184.214
linux-image-4.4.0-184-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-184.214
linux-image-4.4.0-184-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-184.214
linux-image-4.4.0-184-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-184.214
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-184-generic - 4.4.0-184.214
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-184-lowlatency - 4.4.0-184.214
No subscription required

linux-image-4.8.0-39-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-39-generic-lpae - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-39-lowlatency - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.8.0-39-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1075-kvm - 4.4.0-1075.82
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1109-aws - 4.4.0-1109.120
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1031-aws - 4.15.0-1031.33~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.11.0-1015-azure - 4.11.0-1015.15
linux-image-extra-4.11.0-1015-azure - 4.11.0-1015.15
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1041-fips - 4.4.0-1041.46
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1041-fips - 4.4.0-1041.46

Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-184.214').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1075.82').

linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1041.46').
linux-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').
